      Jaleise Hall 
      Master’s Candidate
      Lompoc, California

      
      |
      
      
       jaleise_hall@ucsb.edu |
      
       jaleisehall |
      
      

      
      Education
      Master of Environmental Science and Management, 3.58 GPA (Expected June 2021) Bren School of Environmental Science & Management - University of California: Santa Barbara (UCSB)  Specialization: Pollution Prevention and Remediation & Energy and Climate | Focus: Environmental Data Science  Course Highlights: Energy Demand Analysis, Biological Waste Treatment, Pollution Prevention, Energy and Resource Productivity, Fate & Transport of Pollutants, Advanced Data Analysis, Computing for Environmental Science & Management (All courses completed by June 2021)
      Bachelor of Arts in Music Business Management (Minor in Biology), 3.91 GPA (May 2018)Columbia College Chicago
      Business Course Highlights: Business Writing, Entertainment Law, Entrepreneurship  Awards: Dean’s List (All 6 Semesters) | Recruiting Award: $12,000
      Interdisciplinary Undergraduate Program (Non-Matriculated), 3.1 GPA (July 2018) University of Washington - Friday Harbor Laboratories
      Summer Course: Marine Invertebrate Zoology a 5-week intensive lab and field work course
      
      
      Experience / Projects
      Water-Energy Nexus, Santa Barbara, CA (4/2020 – present) Role: Data Manager | Client: Moulton Niguel Water District (MNWD)  - Developed and organized metadata for a wide range of large datasets  - Performed data wrangling and analysis using R-Studio
      Data Analysis Intern – Moulton Niguel Water District (MNWD), Aliso Viejo, CA (6/20 – 8/20)  - Managed the spread of data received under multiple collaborative platforms (GitHub, Jupyter Notebook, Zotero, Box, Google Drive)  - Wrangled data to analyze energy consumption in MNWD
      Event Host – Santa Barbara Zoo, Santa Barbara, CA (09/2019 – 03/2020)  - Overseeing preparations and meeting time requirements for various zoo events of 150 – 4,000 guests  - Ensuring high level of customer service by escorting service providers, guests, and clients to the event site
      Team Lead – Emagine Theatres, Royal Oak, MI (04/2014 – 08/2019)  - Trained up to 4 employees each month by making sure they were aware of company policies, practiced good customer service skills, and paid attention to new and changing work methods  - Developed and received approval for a clean-cut system for upkeep and daily duties for 4 different areas of the theatre  - Forged relationships with guest by providing a luxury experience based on and increasing company image  - Took initiative to delegate tasks for efficiency in team environments  - Adapted to new work methods and tasks quickly by utilizing strong time management skills learning from past hurdles
      
      
      Interests
      Coding in R 
      Making maps with GIS 
      Drawing 
      Sculpting

articles.contents:
Jaleise Hall

              Jaleise Hall

            I am a Master’s candidate who graduated from Columbia College Chicago in 2018 with a Bachelor of Arts in Music Business Management with a minor in biology. I received my degree in just three years and ended up finding a much deeper interest in the entrepreneurial and managerial aspects of the major, rather than the musical aspects. In my Entrepreneurship class, my interest in environmental science was sparked with the help of my semester long venture assignment in which I planned, marketed, and laid out costs for a waste-diminishing product. I was guided by my professor and mentor Elizabeth Davis-Berg to enroll in an intensive Marine Invertebrate Zoology summer course at the University of Washington. During my time studying marine inverts native to the San Juan Islands, I developed a love for various strange marine worms. After doing some reading on these worms, I came across a few articles that talked about their consumption of plastics and how they help produce microplastics through their excretions. I currently specialize in Pollution Prevention & Remediation and Energy & Climate with an Environmental Data Science focus at the Bren School of Environmental Science and Management.
